snippet: Georgia’s pardon board should commute the death sentence of a mentally retarded man to life without parole.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Georgia statute requiring a defendant to meet the heavy burden of proving mental retardation beyond a reasonable doubt, a measure that flouts Supreme Court's ban on executing mentally retarded offenders; notes that Georgia has issued a warrant to execute Warren Lee Hill Jr, a death-row inmate with an IQ of 70, and calls on state's pardon board to commute the sentence to life without parole.
lead_paragraph: Georgia’s pardon board should commute the death sentence of a mentally retarded man to life without parole.

headline.seo: A Plea for Mercy for Man on Georgia’s Death Row
